Text: New ePerspectives from Dallas FedePerspectives Vol Issue Community Affairs Federal Reserve Bank of Dallas In this issue Did You Know The Community Reinvestment Act regulation is being reviewed by the regulatory agencies The Advance Notice of Proposed Rulemaking is available online in Did You Know The CRA review will be discussed at the New Roads and eRoads conference on August Building for Special Needs in East Texas Pineywoods HOME Team worked with Regions Bank Moore Building Associates and TDHCA to develop affordable singlefamily rental houses in Lufkin and Nacogdoches Survey of LowIncome Housing Tax Credit Properties Beginning in the year affordability period will end for units of LIHTC housing developed in Texas from to The Dallas Fed surveyed owners to determine if the properties will remain affordable providing useful information on the future of these properties You have received this message because you subscribe to the Federal Reserve Bank of Dallas Community Affairs announcement list To unsubscribe send a blank message to To change your email address send a message to with your old address in the subject line For questions or comments please contact us at This message was launched into cyberspace to

Dallas Fed Community Development Lending ConferenceNEW ROADS EROADS Market Innovations in Community Development August Conference Registration Brochure htmdallaseventsnewroadshtml The Dallas Fed invites you to attend New Roads and eRoads Market Innovations in Community Development This conference will provide an opportunity for bankers community development professionals government officials and community leaders to discuss the changing banking environment the Community Reinvestment Act review new technologies influence on community development bridging small business capital gaps New Markets Tax Credits and much more Featured Speakers Include Robert D McTeer Jr New Economy champion and president and CEO of the Dallas Fed Robert L Woodson Sr founder and president of the National Center for Neighborhood Enterprise often called the godfather of the neighborhood empowerment movement David Coulter vice chairman of JP Morgan Chase Co and leader of the banks Internet initiatives Glenn Yago director of capital studies at the Milken Institute and author of Emerging Domestic Markets The Minority Business Challenge REGISTER TODAY You have received this message because you subscribe to the Federal Reserve Bank of Dallas Community Affairs announcement list To unsubscribe send a blank message to To change your email address send a message to with your old address in the subject line For questions or comments please contact us at This message was launched into cyberspace to
